MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's hands-on experience with required technologies (C#, .NET, SQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS) and their ability to apply them in practical scenarios. Verify their familiarity with software development lifecycle phases.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with required technologies; lacks understanding of SDLC.
Some familiarity with a few required technologies; basic understanding of SDLC.
Proficient with most required technologies; good understanding of SDLC.
Expert-level proficiency with all required technologies; comprehensive understanding of SDLC and best practices.

MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical issues. Assess their troubleshooting methodologies and their capacity to think critically under pressure.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Struggles to identify and resolve basic technical issues; lacks a systematic approach.
Can resolve simple technical issues with guidance; demonstrates a basic troubleshooting approach.
Independently resolves complex technical issues; utilizes effective troubleshooting methodologies.
Exceptional problem-solving and troubleshooting skills; proactively identifies and resolves potential issues; mentors others.

MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences. Evaluate their ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Poor communication skills; struggles to articulate technical concepts; difficulty working in a team.
Adequate communication skills; can explain basic technical concepts; able to work in a team with some guidance.
Good communication skills; clearly explains technical concepts; effectively collaborates in a team environment.
Excellent communication skills; effectively communicates complex technical concepts to diverse audiences; leads collaborative efforts and mentors others.

MainCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's willingness and ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing project requirements. Evaluate their capacity to quickly grasp new concepts and apply them effectively.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Resistant to learning new technologies; struggles to adapt to changing requirements.
Willing to learn new technologies but requires significant guidance; adapts slowly to changing requirements.
Quickly learns new technologies; adapts well to changing requirements; proactively seeks out new knowledge.
Demonstrates exceptional learning agility; rapidly masters new technologies and adapts seamlessly to changing requirements; drives innovation and continuous improvement.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Review code samples for adherence to coding standards, clarity, and maintainability. Assess the candidate's understanding of code refactoring and best practices.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Code is poorly written, difficult to understand, and does not follow coding standards.
Code is functional but lacks clarity and maintainability; some adherence to coding standards.
Code is generally well-written and maintainable; adheres to most coding standards.
Code is exceptionally well-written, maintainable, and adheres to all coding standards; demonstrates mastery of code refactoring and best practices.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Evaluate the candidate's proficiency in writing SQL queries, designing database schemas, and optimizing database performance.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no SQL experience; unable to write basic queries.
Can write basic SQL queries but struggles with complex queries and database design.
Proficient in writing SQL queries and designing basic database schemas.
Expert-level SQL skills; designs and optimizes complex database schemas; proficient in performance tuning.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's understanding of testing methodologies and their ability to write unit tests, integration tests, and perform quality assurance activities.

ScoringGuided.Comment: Limited or no experience with testing methodologies; unable to write basic tests.
Familiar with basic testing concepts but struggles to write effective tests.
Proficient in writing unit tests and performing basic quality assurance activities.
Expert-level testing skills; designs and implements comprehensive testing strategies; proficient in automated testing and CI/CD pipelines.

SubCategory.EvaluationStrategy: Assess the candidate's understanding and application of software design patterns (e.g., Singleton, Factory, Observer).

ScoringGuided.Comment: Unaware of common software design patterns.
Aware of some design patterns but unable to apply them effectively.
Understands and applies several common design patterns.
Demonstrates mastery of design patterns and applies them appropriately to solve complex problems.
